mdRecord.dcterms:title: Document, Account of Jean-Antoine Houdon with Benjamin Franklin, 1785 July 26-27
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This leaf from the sculptor Houdon's ledger was submitted for payment to Franklin's son, William, in Paris. It lists traveling expenses for Houdon and several of his assistants, including passage of Houdon to Southampton, England, from Havre, France, and from Southampton to America. Houdon's services were secured by Benjamin Franklin and Thomas Jefferson, then ministers to the Court of France, to create a bust of George Washington for a sculpture ordered by the state of Virginia. After the lengthy trip across the Atlantic, Houdon arrived at Mount Vernon in September 1785.
